alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 6:59PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Moderate rain from Thursday through Saturday morning led to rises on the Little Popo Agie River. There is a chance overnight into early Sunday morning for brief heavy rain, but widespread heavy rainfall is not expected. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas, with the best chance of flooding in Lyons Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 644 PM MDT, Saturday, June 3, water levels on the Little Popo Agie River had crested and were slowly falling. Minor flooding of the river and its smaller tributaries is expected through Sunday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lyons Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
